channel.title: Reads on Biological Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in Reads on Biological Data Science

item.title: Docker
item.description: Install Docker (Community Edition, free & open source) for your laptop. (Mac, Windows, & Linux) Launch the Docker command line, and run: docker pull rocker/r-base to download the image we’ll be using in class. If either of these steps do not work for you, don’t worry, we should be able to fix any special cases in class. Debugging Docker Install MacOS Docker installation is pretty robust on MacOS now.

item.title: Geospatial Data & Visualization
item.description: Reading Our geospatial module is meant only as an introduction to geospatial data, an already-rich area in R that is in mid-Renaissance right now, just as tabular data was in the past few years since the introduction of dplyr and the rest of tidyverse. GeoSpatial Textbook: Geocomputation with R (Lovelace, Nowosad, Muenchow) Chapter 1: Introduction Basic Visualization tools Also read over the following vignettes: Static maps: tmap Vignette Interactive maps: mapview Vignette Watch UPDATED DataCamp now has a more modern course from Zev Ross, Spatial Analysis in R with sf and raster that more closely aligns with the tools we will be using in this module (matching the Geocomputation reading above).

item.title: Intro to spatial data
item.description: Reading Brunsdon and Comber (2020) Opening practice: supporting reproducibility and critical spatial data science. Journal of Geographical Systems https://doi.org/10.1007/s10109-020-00334-2 Chapter 1: Introduction Introduction to APIs [Nice blog post]

item.title: Iteration
item.description: Read R for Data Science textbook on Iteration: [r4ds-21] Looping [SW carepntries]

item.title: Lists
item.description: Reading Good background on list objects Decent primer on apply statements

item.title: Modeling probabilistic processes
item.description: Read Intro to probability distributions [cyclismo tutorial] SIR model tutorial [SIR]

item.title: Parallelization
item.description: Readings Burton, A. W. (1991). Parallel processing in large-scale simulation: motivation and methods. Computing & Control Engineering Journal, 2(2), 74-79. working with lists Focus on the lists subsection [Advanced R] parallel computing in R Parallel computing in R [NCEAS tutorial] parallel package [blog post]

item.title: plyr and dplyr
item.description: RStudio Primers Working with Data Isolating Data with dplyr Derive Information with dplyr Readings dplyr basic verbs: filter, arrange, select, and mutate, [r4ds-5.1 - 5.5] group_by, summarize and friends [r4ds-5.6 - 5.7] Relational Data (*_join functions) r4ds-13.1 - 13.7 Resources for continuous integration Introduction [Travis-CI] Introduction [Github Actions]

item.title: programming basics
item.description: Complete the Programming Basics Primer on RStudio Cloud. Reading Introduction [r4ds-27.1] R Markdown [r4ds-27.2] Code chunks [r4ds-27.4] Getting help in R R’s Documentation Getting Help Guide 1.6: Getting Help Reference R Markdown Cheat Sheet R Markdown Reference Guide

item.title: R plotting
item.description: Reading Introduction [Base plotting] Principles of data visualization [Intro to DS] Function writing resource R for Data Science textbook: [r4ds-19]

item.title: SDMs and model performance
item.description: Reading Breiman, L. (2001). Statistical modeling: The two cultures (with comments and a rejoinder by the author). Statistical science, 16(3), 199-231. SDMs SDM intro Model performance and model comparison Norberg et al. 2020

item.title: SDMs and model performance
item.description: Reading Breiman, L. (2001). Statistical modeling: The two cultures (with comments and a rejoinder by the author). Statistical science, 16(3), 199-231. SDMs SDM intro Model performance and model comparison Norberg et al. 2020

item.title: Setup
item.description: Reading The syllabus Other resources Carey et al. (2019) Enhancing collaboration between ecologists and computer scientists: lessons learned and recommendations forward Dynamic ecology blog post on comments from EO Wilson and the role of theory and code in ecology A beginner’s guide to reproducible research paper Prerequisites Running R code

item.title: Statistical modeling
item.description: Reading Spatial visualization resources Static maps: tmap Vignette Interactive maps: mapview Vignette

item.title: The VIRION data
item.description: Reading Introduction [The VIRION data] Read the opening sections of chapter 13 on Strings and working with Regular Expressions: Sections 14.1 - 14.3.

item.title: Version control and the command line
item.description: Reading for this week: Ram 2013. Git can facilitate greater reproducibility and increased transparency in science. Source code for biology and medicine, 8(1), 1-8. Other resources Git Setup: HappyGitWithR.com Introduction to GitHub: GitHub intro
